meanings.definition: The practice of serving as a surrogate mother.
meanings.sent1: Many families turn to surrogacies for help in having a baby.
meanings.sent2: Surrogacies can bring joy to couples who are unable to conceive on their own.
meanings.sent3: The surrogacies at the clinic were all excited to help create new families.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to pursue surrogacies was like planting seeds of hope for others.
meanings.sent5: The bond formed through surrogacies is as strong as any biological connection.

meanings.definition: The act of serving as a substitute or replacement for someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, surrogacies are common when a family member is unable to work.
meanings.sent2: The surrogacies of teachers during summer break ensure students still receive education.
meanings.sent3: The cat's surrogacies for the missing mouse led to a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His role as a mentor was a surrogacies for the father figure he never had.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella acted as a surrogacies for the missing roof during the storm.
